wikipedia_page.main: Thomas Hill Jamieson (1843–1876) was a Scottish librarian.

response: Librarian Samuel Halkett began an ambitious catalogue, based on the rules of John Winter Jones for the British Museum catalogue of 1839, but with extensive  biographical information on authors. It was published in six volumes, from 1858 to 1878.Cadell & Matheson, pp. 211–2. Halkett's successor, Thomas Hill Jamieson, had to deal with a fire that damaged some thousands of books on 9 March 1875.
